addProductCommand.description: Adds a product to the product catalog.

application.description: Contains information about the application or API.

contact.description: Contact information for the exposed API.

eventEntry.description: An entry of an event that has been raised.

externalDocs.description: Allows referencing an external resource for extended documentation.

getEventsRequest.description: Message to get the events that have occurred within the service context.

getRequestsRequest.description: Message to get requests that have happened in the service context.

getResponsesRequest.description: Message to get responses that have been provided in a service context.

license.description: License information for the exposed API.

openApiDocument.description: This is the root document object for the API specification. It combines what previously was the Resource Listing and API Declaration (version 1.2 and earlier) together into one document.

requestEntry.description: Represents a request log entry - something that tracks the request at the application level.

responseEntry.description: An entry to capture the response, or action, of a request.

schema.description: The Schema Object allows the definition of input and output data types. These types can be objects, but also primitives and arrays. This object is based on the JSON Schema Specification Draft 4 and uses a predefined subset of it. On top of this subset, there are extensions provided by this specification to allow for more complete documentation.

tag.description: Allows adding meta data to a single tag that is used by the Operation Object. It is not mandatory to have a Tag Object per tag used there.

validationError.description: Represents a validation error and contains user facing messaging.

xml.description: A metadata object that allows for more fine-tuned XML model definitions. When using arrays, XML element names are not inferred(for singular/plural forms) and the name property should be used to add that information.See examples for expected behavior.

get.description: Gets the events that have occurred within the service context.

parameters.name: End
parameters.description: The end of the requested range.

parameters.name: Start
parameters.description: The start of the requested range.

get.description:
Checks the health of the service and returns nothing if everything is good.  If there is an issue with the system health then
            an exception is thrown.

204.description: No content is returned from this endpoint.

200.description: This is the root document object for the API specification. It combines what previously was the Resource Listing and API Declaration (version 1.2 and earlier) together into one document.

get.description: Gets requests that have happened in the service context.

parameters.name: End
parameters.description: The end of the requested range.

parameters.name: Start
parameters.description: The start of the requested range.

get.description: Gets responses that have been provided in a service context.

parameters.name: End
parameters.description: The end of the requested range.

parameters.name: Start
parameters.description: The start of the requested range.

post.description: Adds a product to the product catalog.

204.description: No content is returned from this endpoint.

400.description:
1. ProductId must be specified.

1. The product quantity must be greater than 0.
